title: Georgia House Democrats walk out over vote to ban prisons from providing gender-affirming care
summary:
# Georgia House Democrats Walk Out Over Vote to Ban Prisons from Providing Gender-Affirming Care

## Overview
The Georgia House session was marked by a demonstration and walkout by Democrats in protest of SB 1885, a bill that would ban the use of state funds for gender-affirming care for transgender prisoners. Republicans criticized the Democrats' decision to leave the chamber during the vote.

## Key Actions
**SB 1885**: Bill to ban the use of state funds for gender-affirming care for transgender prisoners in Georgia

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
None noted.

## Notable Moments
- Democrats spoke in opposition to SB 1885, questioning why the legislature was so "obsessed" with transgender citizens' personal lives.
- After the speeches, the Democratic members walked out of the chamber in protest.
- Republicans criticized the Democrats' walkout, calling it the "most disheartening moment" they had experienced during their service in the House.

## Votes
- SB 1885 passed by a vote of 100-2.

## Attendance
Quorum was maintained despite the Democratic walkout.

## Adjournment
The session adjourned. The next session date was not specified.
